common_issues.title: PiecesOS Installation and Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with PiecesOS installation, cloud service connectivity, and local LLM usage. Solutions include verifying internet connection, checking firewall settings, removing duplicate installations, using smaller local LLMs, and contacting support for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohanrathi99 reported issues in PiecesOS:
    * Trouble making requests to cloud services (Copilot)
    * Difficulty using local models
* Mark-at-pieces:
    * Suspected firewall/network configurations causing issues
    * Requested logs for com.pieces.os && com.pieces.pfd

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark reviewed logs.
* Rohanrathi99 shared logs via Google Drive.
* Issue for cloud LLMs:
    * Personal OpenApi key usage (resolved by removing the key)
* Issue for local LLMs:
    * Likely caused by hardware constraints (resolved by using a smaller local LLM)
* Scheduled call for February 25, 2025, to discuss further.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Cloud LLM issue resolved by key removal.
* Local LLM issue likely caused by hardware constraints. Smaller model recommended.
* Call scheduled on February 25, 2025 for further investigation.

related_issues.title: Installing Ollama - Forever
related_issues.text:
Installing Ollama - Forever
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/677e938c-3198-4f1b-af00-b22543704fcc)

I have Ollama installed and this is stuck like this forever. I even tried uninstalling Ollama. Still the same :-(
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** Ollama installation failing in Pieces.

**Key points raised:**

* User (@waseem852) tried installing Ollama via various methods (Pieces, manually, winget) but it's failing.
* User is unsure what they are doing wrong.

**Problems identified:**

* Ollama installation not successful despite multiple attempts.
* User unable to resolve the issue independently.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Brian from Pieces support team suggested restarting Pieces OS and Desktop.
* Brian offered to schedule a call to debug the issue further.
* User agreed to the call.

**Current status/outcome:**

* A call is scheduled to further diagnose and resolve the issue.
* The specific cause of the installation failure is yet to be determined.

**Additional notes:**

* Brian provided helpful resources during the initial interaction.
* The conversation demonstrates responsive and helpful support from the Pieces team.

### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation ##

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@MR-AAYU) is experiencing issues booting up the Pieces Desktop application.
* User provided log files for analysis.
* It appears the user has Pieces for Developers installed twice on their machine, causing conflicts.

**Problems Identified:**

* Duplicate installation of Pieces for Developers.
* Incomplete information regarding Pieces OS installation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Check for duplicate installations and remove one.
* Verify the installation of Pieces OS and provide logs if necessary.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* No further updates from the user. 
* The issue remains unresolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user is politely requesting a fix ASAP, but does not provide additional information.
* More information is needed from the user to diagnose the problem accurately and provide a solution.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Account Linking and Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users report problems with PiecesOS account linking, particularly with Google and GitHub integration. Some experience difficulties connecting to cloud services or using local LLMs due to potential firewall, network configuration, or hardware constraints. Solutions include verifying installations, checking network settings, removing conflicting personal API keys, and using smaller local LLMs. Pieces team actively investigates issues and offers support via GitHub and scheduled calls.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@johnkennyuk) is unable to create shareable links in Pieces.
* The user's account linking is not functioning correctly, resulting in two separate accounts.
* The current linking flow is not ideal and is being replaced in mid-to-late February.
* The user wants to keep their Google account as the main account.

**Problems Identified:**

* Incorrect account linking.
* Old and buggy authentication service.
* Case inconsistency in email addresses.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark from Pieces team offered to resolve the issue manually.
* Mark proposed merging the user's accounts into their Google account.
* Mark suggested waiting for the new authentication service to be released.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The new authentication service is still under development and is expected to be released in early/mid March.
* The issue has not been resolved.
* The user is waiting for the new service to be released.

**Additional Notes:**

* The Pieces team is aware of the issue and is working on a solution.
* The current workaround is to wait for the new authentication service.
* The user is being kept informed of the progress.

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

    * Difficulty using local models

    * Likely caused by hardware constraints (resolved by using a smaller local LLM)

common_issues.title: Ollama Installation and Startup Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS failing to recognize existing Ollama installations, leading to startup errors. This might involve Cuda dll errors or infinite installation loops. Proposed solutions include reinstalling Ollama, Pieces OS, or both, and ensuring Pieces OS is not launching its own Ollama instance.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Ollama Installation Problems

**Key Points:**

* User johnkennyuk reported multiple installation issues with Ollama on PiecesOS.
* The primary issue was the system failing to recognize an existing installation and attempting to start its own instance, leading to errors.
* The underlying cause was suspected to be a race condition between Ollama and PiecesOS startup processes.

**Problems Identified:**

* Duplicate Ollama installations due to faulty winget installation.
* PiecesOS failing to recognize existing Ollama installations.
* Cuda12 dll missing or corrupted.
* Race condition between Ollama and PiecesOS startup processes.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Reinstalling Ollama via OllamaSetup.exe installer.
* Uninstalling and reinstalling both Ollama and PiecesOS.
* Cleaning up path environment variables.
* Implementing changes in PiecesOS version 11.1.2 to address the race condition.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was initially resolved for the user after multiple reinstalls and cleanups.
* However, the user continued to experience the issue after updates.
* A potential fix was implemented in PiecesOS version 11.1.2.
* Further investigation is needed to determine the effectiveness of the fix.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user disabled PiecesOS launch on startup as a temporary workaround.
* The user requested the ability for PiecesOS to detect and utilize external Ollama installations.
* The developer confirmed the ability to detect and interact with external Ollama instances.

This summary provides a concise overview of the key points, problems, solutions, and current status of the issue.

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces for Developers failing to connect to cloud services or utilize local LLMs. This can be due to firewall configurations, incorrect API keys, hardware limitations, or duplicate installations. Solutions include checking network settings, verifying API keys, using smaller LLMs, or ensuring a single Pieces for Developers installation.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Marius Kowalski (@mariusz-kowalski) reported an issue with the Pieces desktop app.
* The issue appears to be related to specific Linux machines.
* The Pieces support team requested a log file and offered a video call for troubleshooting.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces desktop app is experiencing an unspecified issue on certain Linux machines.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The support team requested a log file from the affected user.
* They also offered a video call for live troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Mariusz Kowalski provided the log file.
* The Pieces support team has not yet responded to the log file or scheduled a video call.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue appears to be similar to other reports received through different support channels.
* The exact cause of the issue is currently unknown.

I hope this summary is helpful. Please let me know if you have any questions.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: "Pieces for VS Code crashes with 'Pieces OS is not running' error"

**Key points raised:**

* ThemePark reported an issue with Pieces for VS Code crashing after 10 minutes, displaying a non-dismissable "Pieces OS is not running" message.
* Screenshot of the error message was provided.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces for VS Code crashed unexpectedly.
* Error message incorrectly indicated that Pieces OS was not running, while it was running.
* Non-dismissable message prevented further use of the extension.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The issue was initially suspected to be related to a timing conflict between Pieces Desktop and Pieces OS launching on startup, but later identified as a separate problem.
* Mack, from Pieces support team, requested additional information about startup configuration.
* ThemePark confirmed using Pieces OS as the startup application.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Root cause of the issue remains unidentified.
* Mack requested further information to help diagnose the problem.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation suggests ongoing communication between ThemePark and Pieces support team to resolve the issue.
* ThemePark provided additional details about the timeline of the crash and the error message. 
* Mack acknowledged the problem and requested further information for diagnosis.
* Outcome of the conversation and resolution of the issue are not yet clear.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation ##

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@MR-AAYU) is experiencing issues booting up the Pieces Desktop application.
* User provided log files for analysis.
* It appears the user has Pieces for Developers installed twice on their machine, causing conflicts.

**Problems Identified:**

* Duplicate installation of Pieces for Developers.
* Incomplete information regarding Pieces OS installation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Check for duplicate installations and remove one.
* Verify the installation of Pieces OS and provide logs if necessary.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* No further updates from the user. 
* The issue remains unresolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user is politely requesting a fix ASAP, but does not provide additional information.
* More information is needed from the user to diagnose the problem accurately and provide a solution.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohanrathi99 reported issues in PiecesOS:
    * Trouble making requests to cloud services (Copilot)
    * Difficulty using local models
* Mark-at-pieces:
    * Suspected firewall/network configurations causing issues
    * Requested logs for com.pieces.os && com.pieces.pfd

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark reviewed logs.
* Rohanrathi99 shared logs via Google Drive.
* Issue for cloud LLMs:
    * Personal OpenApi key usage (resolved by removing the key)
* Issue for local LLMs:
    * Likely caused by hardware constraints (resolved by using a smaller local LLM)
* Scheduled call for February 25, 2025, to discuss further.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Cloud LLM issue resolved by key removal.
* Local LLM issue likely caused by hardware constraints. Smaller model recommended.
* Call scheduled on February 25, 2025 for further investigation.

recommendations: "Investigate and address the root causes of PiecesOS installation and launch issues to reduce ticket volume."
"Improve documentation and user guidance on PiecesOS account linking, network configuration, and Ollama integration to prevent common issues."
"Explore solutions to improve PiecesOS and Pieces for Developers compatibility with existing Ollama installations."
"Prioritize resolving issues related to cloud service and local LLM connectivity, particularly on Windows and for Pieces for Developers."
"Review and optimize the account linking process, specifically for Google and GitHub integration, to ensure seamless user experience."
